name: UPDATE
shortDescription: Modify existing rows in a table
description: Update documents in an Elasticsearch index that match the WHERE clause. Uses the update_by_query API internally. Without a WHERE clause, ALL documents will be updated.

clauses.name: SET
clauses.description: Column-value pairs to update. Values can be literals or expressions.

clauses.name: WHERE
clauses.description: Filter condition to select documents to update

examples.title: Update single field
examples.sql:
UPDATE users
SET status = 'active'
WHERE id = 1

examples.title: Update multiple fields
examples.sql:
UPDATE products
SET price = price * 1.1, updated_at = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
WHERE category = 'Electronics'

examples.title: Update with expression
examples.sql:
UPDATE orders
SET total = quantity * unit_price
WHERE total IS NULL

examples.title: Update nested field
examples.sql:
UPDATE users
SET profile.verified = true
WHERE email_confirmed = true

examples.title: Update with complex condition
examples.sql:
UPDATE accounts
SET status = 'inactive', deactivated_at = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
WHERE last_login < DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE, INTERVAL 1 YEAR)
  AND status = 'active'

notes: Without WHERE clause, all documents will be updated
Changes are not atomic across multiple documents
Large updates may take significant time
